Gaza: As UN declares famine, Israel condemns what it calls an antisemitic campaign
description: A report published Friday confirms a major food crisis, with more than 500,000 Gazans already facing famine. This situation is the result of prolonged periods of blockade. The Israeli government disputes these accusations and Benjamin Netanyahu dismisses them as antisemitic prejudice.

description: Iranians remain on edge two months after the end of the 12-day war, worried about renewed fighting with Israel and burdened by inflation and water and power shortages.

headline: The mysteries of actress Isabelle Adjani's vocation
description: 'Adjani, The Famous Stranger' (1/6). Nothing seemed to predestine her to become one of the greatest stars of French cinema. Yet the young actress, born to an Algerian father and a German mother, experienced a meteoric rise. She made her debut on stage at barely 17 years old and quickly transitioned to film.

headline: Women's Rugby World Cup: France enters tournament aiming for title
description: France kicks off its World Cup campaign on Saturday in Exeter against Italy. The third-place regulars now have their sights set on outright victory.

headline: Being a writer in an age of digital omnipresence: James Baldwin 'seemed free in ways we sense we no longer can be'
description: 'Letters from America' (6/6). Writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams envies the great American author's bohemian, technology-free existence, despite the chaos it represented.

headline: How the 2024 Olympics transformed Greater Paris into a supersized stadium
description: Previously unpublished data on visitor numbers in Paris and its suburbs during the 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games reveal how the city and its residents adapted, and how the Games accelerated Paris's transformation.
